FuncDef:
The filter-policy export command filters imported routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
The undo filter-policy export command restores the default setting. The filter-policy export command filters imported routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy. The undo filter-policy export command restores the default setting. By default, the imported routes to be advertised are not filtered. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of an IPv6 prefix list.
The value is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies to filter imported direct routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Specifies to filter imported BGP routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Specifies to filter imported static routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Specifies to filter imported RIPng routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Displays information about the ABR or ASBR of an OSPF route in a specified OSPF process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies to filter imported IS-IS routes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Specifies to filter imported OSPFv3 routes from other OSPFv3 processes to be advertised based on a filtering policy.
-

Specifies the number of a basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.
